trans-unit.target: At that time the haters will rise

trans-unit.note: مساتير plural of مستور BH: 1) wealthy, 2) having one's basic needs provided for. Here the reference is to people formerly in the service of the Mamluks, who have become integrated into Egyptian society, like أولاد الناس.

trans-unit.target: The students of Al-Azhar and the adjuncts(?)

trans-unit.source: سَيَرَوْنَ في الْمَحَابِيْسِ كُلَّ مَنْ أَمْسَكَهُمْ زَكَرِيَّا مَسَاكِيْنَ
trans-unit.target: They will see in the dungeons that everyone seized by Zakkariya is a wretch

trans-unit.note: Literally, the owners of their souls did not conspire

trans-unit.target: They did not rob each other

trans-unit.source: لَمْ يَقُلْ سَبَابًا في طَرِيْقٍ عَامٍ ضِدَّ أَمِيْرٍ أَوْ كَبَيْرٍ
trans-unit.target: They uttered no insult in the public way against any Emir or senior [official]
